title: Venetian Star #1
name: Venetian Star
geometry: 6 8-unit stars, descending in size, form this model. I used a ratio of 0.793 for the paper sizes.

title: Arijigoku lamp #1
name: Arijigoku (Ant-Lion Nest)
geometry: This model is made from a combination of pentagons and hexagons.

title: Rose Unit Variation Lamp #1
name: Rose unit variation
designer: Original rose unit created by Tomoko Fuse, variation by me
geometry: I created this variation on Fuse's rose unit for this lamp. The model is built from 12 pentagons and 36 hexagons, which provide the curvature for the lamp.

title: Sonobe Wall Hanging
name: Sonobe
geometry: 'Sonobe carpet', as it is sometimes called, is only made of hexagons which provide the neutral curvature.

title: Arijigoku cylinderical lamp
name: Arijigoku (Ant-Lion Nest)
units: I didn't count or plan-- my estimate is around 1100.
geometry: I experimented with a taper at the top and the bottom of the lamp, to keep it secure to the frame. I included 4 vertices of pentagons on each end.

title: Arijigoku sphere
name: Arijigoku (Ant-Lion Nest)
geometry: One of my small-paper endeavors-- paper size is 1x2cm

title: Rose Unit Variation Lamp #2
name: Rose unit variation
designer: Original rose unit created by Tomoko Fuse, variation by me
geometry: I created this variation on Fuse's rose unit for this lamp. The model is built from 12 pentagons and 36 hexagons, which provide the curvature for the lamp.

title: PHiZZ Torus
name: PHiZZ
geometry: This model is made from a combination of pentagons, hexagons, and heptagons which ultimately create the curvature of the torus.

title: Egg lamp
name: Fiesta model
geometry: This lamp has vertices of 4 edges at the top and the bottom, which create the egg-like shape.

name: Venetian Star
geometry: 6 8-unit stars, descending in size, form this model. I used a ratio of 0.793 for the paper sizes.

title: Sonobe lamp #2
name: Sonobe
geometry: This model is made from a combination of pentagons and hexagons.

title: Sonobe Cube Lamp
name: Sonobe
geometry: This is a variation on the classic sonobe module that I came up with (though I'm sure others have discovered the same/similar sonobe variations).

title: Small Window Star
name: Window Star
geometry: This is a small star I made, though I'm not sure if the units were an original creation.

title: Torus of Cubes
name: Diamond Window
geometry: This ring is made of cubes built with the diamond window unit.

title: Rose Unit Variation Lamp #2
name: Rose unit variation
designer: Original rose unit by Tomoko Fuse, variation by me
geometry: I created this variation on Fuse's rose unit for this lamp. The model is built from 12 pentagons and 36 hexagons, which provide the curvature for the lamp.

title: Centerpiece lamp
name: Fiesta model
geometry: One of my largest lamps (made from 12cm x 12cm paper). Typical dodecahedron geometry.

title: Ascending dodecahedrons
name: 135 degree unit
geometry: Another 120 unit dodeahedron. Each sphere is 1.2x larger than its sibling.

title: Sonobe lamp
name: Sonobe
geometry: 270 pieces of 1.5 x 1.5 inch paper.

title: Rose unit mobile
name: Rose unit variation
designer: Original rose unit by Tomoko Fuse, variation by me
geometry: Each sphere is 120 units, and has a ratio of 1.55/1 to its smaller sibling

title: Fiesta Lamp #2
name: Fiesta model
geometry: I created the oblong shape of this lamp by using only hexagons in the middle section while using the same pentagon/hexagon combination in the top and bottom.
